result.title: Documentation on activities and outcomes in CS actions, 1st report
result.description: 3.1: Documentation on activities and outcomes in CS actions, 1st report (Public report due at month 12, Lead. ISGlobal) In depth report from the activities conducted in each of the locations. Key results will be published on websites, local non-expert journals and popular journals together with the local citizen group. Each of these deliverables includes documentation of activities, communities involved, description of citizen science projects, research questions explored, data collected, findings, as well as discussion on learning, insights and recommendations for future work and sustainability of the intervention.

result.title: Strategic plan for the exploitation and dissemination of the results (PEDR)
result.description: A clear strategy to the widespread dissemination of the project outcomes and deliverables; and the design of an exploitation strategy ensuring the long-term, post-grant sustainability and replicability of the outcomes and the expansion of the end-user base of the MICS platform. Detailed communication plan, and materials, including logos, templates for presentations, presentations about the project for the use of the partners. This deliverable will be updated and reported at each project meeting, from M04 to M36.

result.title: Report on the harmonisation of methodologies and tools employed for bioenergy sustainability analyses in the EU
result.description: FAO will develop the deliverable. UCLM, FIB, WIP, CREA, GEO, SECB, ENERO, JR, ELO will contribute. It is related to Task 3.1. The deliverable will include the results of the work on the review and harmonisation of methodologies and tools employed for bioenergy sustainability analyses in the EU and will define the base for the development of the project comprehensive software-based interface for the assessment of sustainable bioenergy potential from MUC lands.

result.title: Interim Exploitation Plan for Civic Open Data Engagement
result.description:
Interim Exploitation Plan for Civic Open Data Engagement (report, M24)
This deliverable considers different exploitation aspects of our technical and process innovation beyond the scope of the project: Market potential and business plan, transferability and sustainability.
The interim exploitation plan will be further refined in the second year after the implementation of our approach in Spain and Greece and explore the market potential. The interim business plan will provide a viable business model on how to reach out to the market (e.g. explore different freemium approaches together with potential customers). The interim exploitation plan will be quantitative with estimates for the full implementation costs, turnover, and expected profits for selected services. For the interim exploitation plan TT will outline an agreement for partner roles based on the business model and chosen services.
In addition the interim version will reflect on the challenges encountered during the good practice transfer for co-creation approaches within our project (from UK and Germany to Spain and Greece) and develop a set of guidelines. These guidelines for transferability of our method innovation will also feed into the Good Practice Guidebook. Furthermore will the interim report provide an analysis on how such co-created services may be deployed sustainably (e.g. through migration of our demonstrators to city information providers). This may include public-private partnerships as is the case for Bremen. The analysis will feed into T5.4 (the migration of our project results in the third project year).
All sub-tasks feature considerations about the social or economic impact such applications may have and are derived from T1.4 (Evaluation and impact assessment framework).
The task will be led by TT in collaboration with FTB, AUTH, UPM, ULANC, ifib, RCM and ZAR.

project.title: Mobile Age

result.title: Final Exploitation Plan for Civic Open Data Engagement
result.description:
Final Exploitation Plan for Civic Open Data Engagement (report, M36)
This deliverable considers different exploitation aspects of our technical and process innovation beyond the scope of the project: Market potential and business plan, transferability and sustainability.
The final exploitation plan will review and critically assess the interim business plan and the actions taken in the final project year. Adjustments based on this critical review will be implemented. The final report hence comprises a specified business model, explaining the market potential of the technical and process innovation and paves the way for a rollout beyond the project partners and duration.
The report will further summarise the challenges and requirements for a successful transfer of our co-creation methodology to other settings. It will define how the sustainability of our services and of the data will be ensured (including a business plan for the organisations involved in the maintenance and curation of our products).
All sub-tasks feature considerations about the social or economic impact such applications may have and are derived from T1.4 (Evaluation and impact assessment framework).
The task will be led by TT in collaboration with FTB, AUTH, UPM, ULANC, ifib, RCM and ZAR.

result.title: Exploitation and Sustainability plan
result.description: A report containg the market analysis, segmentation and proposed market strategy for exploiting and commercializing Online S3 results. Moreover it presents the individual exploitation strategies of the platform, a business plan considering the joint exploitation of Online S3 results and the exploitation agreement among partners that will include all decisions related to IPRs of the results of the project.

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Set of midterm practice abstracts
result.description: "Set of 10 practice abstracts in the EIP Agri format based on research undertaken in the first reporting period. These will include: practice abstracts on demonstration activities in 30 countries, each produced in English and the national language; overview of demonstration activities in Northern, Southern and Eastern Europe, each produced in English with the Southern European abstract also produced in Italian and the northern in Polish. A ""practice abstract"" is a short summary of around 1000-1500 characters (word count – no spaces) which describes a main information/recommendation/practice that can serve the end-users in their daily practice. Abstracts will follow the EIP-AGRI guidance available on the web-site."

result.title: PLAID web-site
result.description: HUT will develop and maintain a dedicated project web-site. This will be up-dated at regular intervals throughout the project. It will contain: • descriptions of planned project activities, participants and outputs • the PLAID twitter feed, and blog, links to the PLAID facebook page and You-Tube channel • an open registration survey for populating and up-dating the inventory of demonstration activities (WP3) • links to the inventory database and interactive map (WP3) • profiles on the virtual demonstration farms (including videos) (WP4) and case studies in WP5 • all print outputs (e.g. fact-sheets) and the decision-support tools developed in WP6 • links to partner organisations, IAB home pages, EUFRAS and other related sites

result.title: Workshop report
result.description: A 2-day multistakeholder workshop will be organized to discuss the agronomic and technoeconomic feasibility and sustainability of producing advanced bioenergy in the selected case study sites. The results of this workshop (minutes, ppts, reports, interviews, etc) will be compiled into a report delivered to the stakeholder groups in each target country.
